title: East Coast thunderstorms disrupt hundreds of US flights
description: Airlines and passengers are having the worst day for flight cancellations in a week because of thunderstorms bearing down on East Coast hubs.

title: Sri Lanka's President leaves the country after mass protests forced him to resign
description: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was blocked from departing Sri Lanka on Monday after refusing to join a public queue at the Bandaranaike International Airport in order to have his passport checked by immigration, a high-ranking military source told CNN.

title: Tech company CEO arrested and charged with murder in 1992 killing of California woman, DA says
description: A tech company CEO, who was tried twice in the 1992 killing of his roommate's girlfriend, has been arrested and charged with murder in the case, a California prosecutor said.

title: Twitter sues Elon Musk to force him to complete acquisition
description: Twitter has sued billionaire Elon Musk in an effort to force him to follow through with his deal to buy the social media company.

title: Young people's mental health is getting worse but mindfulness training isn't the answer, large UK study suggests
description: There is a crisis in teen mental health, and schools in many countries are exploring different ways to make young people more resilient.

title: Boeing delivers a 737 Max to one of airlines that suffered a fatal crash of the plane
description: Ethiopian Airlines took delivery of a 737 Max from Boeing in June, the aircraft maker disclosed Tuesday.

title: World's 50 greatest places of 2022, according to TIME magazine
description: Get your credit card out and your favorite booking platforms at the ready: US magazine and news website TIME has just released its list of the world's 50 greatest places of 2022.

title: Genetically modified pig heart transplanted into deceased recipient, researchers say
description: A surgical team transplanted a heart from a genetically modified pig into a deceased human as part of a research study, researchers with NYU Langone Health announced Tuesday.

title: See the lines Trump ad-libbed during his January 6 speech
description: The House select committee investigating the Capitol insurrection presented a video during the seventh hearing of the lines then-President Donald Trump said during his January 6 speech that were not included in his official script.

title: Why former Oath Keepers spokesperson broke with the group
description: During the seventh hearing investigating the January 6 insurrection at the Capitol, Jason Van Tatenhove, a former spokesperson for the Oath Keepers, opened up about the moment when he decided to leave the group.

title: Heathrow asks airlines to halt ticket sales: What you need to know
description: London Heathrow, one of the world's busiest airports, has made the extraordinary move of asking airlines to stop selling tickets for outbound travel this summer.

title: Emmy nominations 2022: See if your favorite shows made the list
description: Nominees for the 74th Primetime Emmy Awards, which honor the best in television, will be revealed on Tuesday morning.

title: Elon Musk: Rocket test explosion 'actually not good'
description: An explosion on the launch pad during a test of a massive SpaceX rocket prototype was "actually not good" and the company is assessing the damage, company CEO Elon Musk said on Twitter.

title: Casey White, the Alabama prisoner who escaped with a corrections officer, has been indicted for her murder
description: Casey White, the inmate who escaped from an Alabama jail with corrections officer Vicky White, has been indicted for felony murder in connection to her death, according to Lauderdale County Circuit Court documents.

title: Economist: Sri Lanka 'could be looking at a famine in a few months' time'
description: Political economist and university professor Ahilan Kadirgamar, who took part in Saturday's protests in Colombo, puts Sri Lanka's economic and political crisis in context with a dire warning about the country's future

title: ISIS leader in Syria killed in drone strike, US says
description: The US carried out a drone strike in northwest Syria on Tuesday that killed Maher al-Agal, the leader of ISIS in Syria, US Central Command said.

title: How a Chinese metal tycoon imploded the nickel market — and walked away with billions
description: Most investors don't lose an $11 billion bet and walk away unscathed, but a Chinese metal tycoon known as "Big Shot" has done exactly that.

title: Dangerous, extended heat wave threatens millions in Western Europe as highest level of heat alerts are issued
description: After the second-warmest June on record, western Europe is bracing for its second dangerous heat wave of the summer.

title: China tries to stem growing anger over frozen bank deposits
description: Chinese authorities will start refunding bank customers whose accounts have been frozen for months, following some of the biggest protests the country has seen since the start of the pandemic.

title: The euro and the US dollar are at parity for the first time in 20 years
description: For the first time in 20 years, the exchange rate between the euro and the US dollar has reached parity -- meaning the two currencies are worth the same.

title: 'The Rocky Mountains on a starry night': See stunning new image from Webb telescope
description: CNN Aerospace Analyst Miles O'Brien joins Becky Anderson to break down the latest photos from the James Webb Space Telescope. The stunning images feature the Carina Nebula, Stephan's Quintet and the Southern Ring Nebula.

title: The Open: Tiger Woods feeling 'a lot stronger' but accepting of his limited schedule future
description: A year ago, Tiger Woods was just hoping he would be able to walk again. On Tuesday, he was all smiles as he navigated his final practice round ahead of a historic Open Championship at St. Andrews in Scotland.

title: Is Warren Buffett ditching China's electric car giant? Investors think so
description: It looks like Warren Buffett has given up on BYD, China's biggest home-grown electric vehicle maker.

title: Justice Department investigating PGA Tour over possible antitrust violations involving LIV Golf
description: The US Justice Department is investigating the PGA Tour over possible antitrust violations involving LIV Golf, the PGA Tour confirmed to CNN Tuesday.

title: Olympic legend reveals he was illegally trafficked into the UK as a child
description: The Olympic legend said in a documentary by the BBC and Red Bull Studios that he was trafficked into the UK under a false name and forced to work as a domestic servant.

title: Philippe Starck's designs are out-of-this-world. Literally
description: In sprawling and dense São Paulo, Brazil, the reclaimed enclave of Cidade Matarazzo is emerging as something of a polished bauble.

title: Americans may get the one presidential race the country doesn't want in 2024
description: There's one tiny sliver of hope for Joe Biden in a devastating new poll that flags rising concerns over the President's age and performance and shows even most Democrats want another candidate in 2024. He could still beat Donald Trump.

title: Iran has arrested three filmmakers in less than a week
description: Acclaimed director Jafar Panahi has become the third Iranian filmmaker to be arrested in the country in less than a week.

title: Former NFL running back Marion Barber died of heatstroke, medical examiner says
description: Former Dallas Cowboys running back Marion Barber III, who was found dead in his Texas apartment in June, died of heatstroke, a medical examiner's report says.

title: Akie Abe, widow of assassinated leader Shinzo Abe, set a new mold for Japanese first ladies
US tourist survives fall into Mount Vesuvius after reaching for phone
description: An American tourist fell into the crater of Mount Vesuvius in an attempt to retrieve his mobile phone at the weekend, Italian police told CNN on Monday.

title: Before our homes got smart: 7 vintage home gadgets that hark back to a bygone era
description: Dutch designer Jaro Gielens' basement is a sight to behold: The 1,000-square-foot space has been converted into a vault for one of the world's largest collections of small household appliances from the 1960s to the 1990s -- featuring mostly items in mint-condition. A niche pursuit, you might be thinking, but together these items hold stories that reach far beyond the walls of his home.

title: Former Super Bowl champion Osi Umenyiora is creating a new path for African talent to make it to the NFL
description: Osi Umenyiora believes American football and African athletes are the perfect combination. Though he didn't start playing football until he was about 15 years old after moving to the US from Nigeria, he built a successful 12-year career in the National Football League (NFL) -- including two Super Bowl wins with the New York Giants.

title: Marion Hollins: The 'It Girl' of golf who broke down barriers
description: Marion Hollins was never afraid to push boundaries.

title: Police have theory about what motivated Shinzo Abe murder suspect
description: According to police, the suspect accused of assassinating former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe had a "grudge" against a church he believed Abe had ties with. CNN's Matthew Chance reports.

title: US officials working on a plan to allow second Covid-19 boosters for all adults
description: US health officials are urgently working on a plan to allow second Covid-19 boosters for all adults, a senior White House official confirmed to CNN on Monday.

title: Biden reveals the James Webb Space Telescope's stunning first image
'They are helpless': How medical aid gets to Ukrainians in need
description: In war-torn Ukraine, civilians who need medication and other medical attention often rely on a mobile pharmacy for aid. CNN's Alex Marquardt reports on the volunteers who help many Ukrainians on the front lines stay healthy.

title: Opposition party official killed at his birthday party in Brazil
description: As Brazil moves toward a contentious election between former leftist president Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva and incumbent right-wing president Jair Bolsonaro, the country's divisions have turned deadly. A supporter of President Bolsonaro is accused of shooting and killing Marcelo Arruda, a member of Brazil's left-wing Worker's Party. CNN's Shasta Darlington reports.

title: Olympic medalist Kim Glass recounts being assaulted outside LA restaurant
description: A Team USA Olympic medal winner says a man attacked her outside a Los Angeles restaurant, hurling a metal object at her and fracturing her eye socket.

title: The complete Elon Musk-Twitter blowup ... in two minutes
description: Editor's Note: This story is part of CNN Business' Nightcap newsletter. To get it in your inbox, sign up for free, here.
